weather_report:
As the serene early hours of the morning unfold in Downtown San Francisco, the city rests under a clear canopy that hints at the calm of a pleasant day ahead. The temperature drops to a slight chill, whispering of winter, yet the promise of bright sunshine is forthcoming. Gentle winds are meandering softly, almost like secretive breaths passing through the corners of the streets. 

When the sun rises, expect its rays to illuminate the city's iconic shapes, casting a serene light that invites you to embrace the day. Although the forecast suggests a high of only 56, the warmth of the sun will still make it feel more inviting, especially as the day progresses and temperatures begin to ease back, allowing a subtle refreshment to linger. The absence of fog is particularly notable today; the marine layer seems to have retreated, granting an unobstructed view of the golden arches of the Golden Gate. Dress comfortably but don layers; a light sweater may be all you need for the cool morning and the refreshing breeze picking up later. With this clarity, a casual stroll through Dolores Park beckons, or perhaps a visit to one of the quieter cafés, where you can sit and enjoy a warm drink while watching the city awaken around you—its vibrant life unfurling with each passing moment.
